title: ASAS App
description: The ASAS app offers calculators for the Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score (ASDAS) and the Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index (BASDAI), as well as information on classification, diagnosis, outcome assessment, and treatment of spondyloarthritis.
descriptionHTML: The ASAS app offers calculators for the Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score (ASDAS) and the Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index (BASDAI), as well as information on classification, diagnosis, outcome assessment, and treatment of spondyloarthritis.
summary: ASAS App - ASDAS Calculator
recentChanges:
- Updated ASDAS calculator
- BASDAI calculator
- Possibility to send the result
- Updated information materials on spondyloarthritis
- Usability improvements
comments: This app will be perfect if also provide progress tracking on the disease outcomes.
One of the best apps with great information. Sharing this in larger group. Thanks for this app.
Love it

title: AS Health Storylines
description:
Developed in partnership with people with Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) and the Canadian Spondylitis Association, this app makes it easy to record your symptoms, fatigue levels, moods, and more. Choose what you want to track to build your own summary ‚ÄúMy Storylines‚Äù to learn more about your health, and to share more ‚Äì safely and securely ‚Äì with your doctor about what happened between visits.

Choose from the following health tools to better manage and monitor your AS or associated spondyloarthritis diseases:


FATIGUE TRACKER
Monitor your fatigue levels to learn more about your energy patterns.

BUILD ROUTINES TO HELP MANAGE YOUR PAIN
Create routines and get reminders for exercising and taking breaks to relieve pain and stiffness.

SYMPTOM TRACKER
Track symptoms and side effects to see patterns that you may need to share with your doctor.

MEDICATION REMINDER
Taking your medications on schedule is an essential part of AS self-care. Keep your mind at ease by receiving reminders for taking your medications on your mobile device. Disclaimer: App only contains medication database for US and Canada at this time. Other countries medication databases coming soon.

SYNC A DEVICE
Import data from other health and fitness apps that you use.

DAILY MOODS AND JOURNAL
Track and understand your emotions and what might be driving them. Keep a journal as it has been shown to increase wellbeing.

FOOD DIARY
Track foods you eat and any reactions triggered if you have related Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD).


By using AS Health Storylines, you have the opportunity to anonymously contribute learning from your story to a vital data resource that the healthcare industry can use to improve care in the future, for people like you.

AS Health Storylines is developed in partnership with the Canadian Spondylitis Association, and is powered by the Health Storylines‚Ñ¢ platform from Self Care Catalysts Inc.

recentChanges: Performance enhancements
comments:
Love the app but unless you want to do endless scrolling to see all your 
data, it need improvement especially for AS patients. We should be able to 
download all of our input data in an excel file. Where is all our data 
stored and why is it impossible to download it to our phones for U.S. users?

It doesn't have all symptoms, if yours is not on the list you can't add it. 
My medication is also not on the list and again you can't add it. I don't 
think you can use this outside the USA

I really like this app. Thankfully I've never had any issues with it. Great reminders, great tracker especially for things that I hadn't thought of tracking but I should. I feel like they thought of everything.
I did like this app.  Then I struggled with it.  Don't need the aggravation with medication reminders not turning on.
Love it,  but a lot of AS injections are biweekly,  which isn't an option in the medication tracker yet.  Can you add that?

title: Back pain relief exercises at home
descriptionHTML:
With this application you will be able to engage in the treatment and prevention of diseases of the back and neck at home. Exercises will help get rid of back pain and strengthen muscles to support the spine.

The application contains a set of complete workouts:
- lower back workouts;
- thoracic spine workouts;
- neck workouts;
- post op and fracture recovery workouts;
- stretching workouts;
- morning exercise;

The application contains more than 100 exercises for the development and strengthening of the muscles of the back, abdomen, shoulder girdle, legs, buttocks and neck. Performing these complexes will ensure your back health and posture correction.

Each exercise has a video instruction and a detailed description of the technique.

Timer and sound instructions allows to perform workout without looking into device.

Create and customise your own workout from existing exercises.

Follow your progress with detailed statistics.

Setup reminder for next trainings.

A warning! If there are intervertebral hernia or protrusions, be sure to consult your doctor before performing the exercises.
summary: Back and neck pain relief exercises. Post Op and fracture recovery. Stretching
recentChanges: Bug fixes
comments: A nice app with lots of options to customise workouts and reps. Really glad for the voice that announces what move is coming next as I always forget and the beeps for each rep. Has helped tremendously in setting up a simple stretching routine to help with my recovery from a back injury.

I've been using this app for my back for years. I didn't realise I hadn't rated it!! Great app. It's really helped me with my back pain as I have a bad posture. In particular I always use the "Stretching the spine" exercises.

At my age and 40 really only concentrated on upper body weight training in past. Thankyou so much for this app! Good option for a simple workout or with an added workout! Life saving stuff, encouraging and easy to follow and stay focused.

I suffer from lower back pain ever since I got sciatica from a back injury. These small workouts actually work better than my rehabilitation workout. A minor delay between the rep countdown and the animation, but better to work at your own pace anyway and do how many you're comfortable doing.

It is a great app to work on all parts of your body. The only disadvantage is that when you want to make your personal plane is gets difficult to order the exercises. I mean moving them up and down one by one is time consuming.

title: Manage My Pain
description:
Chronic pain affects 1 in 5 individuals. It can be hard to explain to friends, family, and doctors. It can feel like it's taking control of your life and your mental health. Learn to conquer your chronic pain. Manage My Pain helps you and others better understand what you are going through. It has helped thousands of people with conditions like fibromyalgia, headaches, arthritis, or back pain better understand their symptoms and provide evidence of their pain for their doctors, insurance companies, or government agencies. Manage My Pain was created in partnership with industry-leading pain researchers - your doctor will actually read the reports from our app! Our daily reflections help people focus on their meaningful activities as opposed to the limitations created by their pain.

Manage My Pain will help you:
‚Ä¢ Record how you're feeling: Easily describe your pain in less than 30 seconds
‚Ä¢ Understand your unique pain criteria: Fully customizable options with each pain record let you identify factors such as how your pain feels, what the factors made the pain worse, which medications help you with your pain, and many more
‚Ä¢ Reflect on your day: Take your mind off pain and record activities that are meaningful to you
‚Ä¢ Highlight patterns and trends: Charts and graphs describe your results and get more powerful over time
‚Ä¢ Track how well your meds are working: Add any medication to your profile and mark if it helps manage your pain
‚Ä¢ Describe your pain to your doctor: Summarize your pain through unique reports that your doctor will actually read

Developed for patients suffering from and care-givers or medical professionals treating: 
‚Ä¢ arthritis & rheumatism
‚Ä¢ cancer 
‚Ä¢ chronic pain
‚Ä¢ headaches & migraines 
‚Ä¢ fibromyalgia 

Use this pain management app to replace your hand-written: 
‚Ä¢ pain diary 
‚Ä¢ pain journal 
‚Ä¢ pain log 
‚Ä¢ pain tracker 

The Pro version adds the ability to view or report on more than the last 30 days. Reports are free to generate, however, those that contain advanced sections may require an additional credit to be purchased. An optional monthly subscription can be purchased so that an unlimited number of reports with advanced sections may be generated without the need for credits.

recentChanges:
Version 3.6.2056:
* Stability, cosmetic, and translation fixes throughout
comments: **UPDATE** after receiving response from customer support (which was expedient and right on the money for what I needed). I absolutely LOVE this app!!! (upgrade from 4 stars to 5!!) Once I was clear on how to use app, I really appreciate having somewhere to log my daily concerns. I do wish there were more specific body parts, but I LOVE that u can put notes in and be more specific there.

Really great free app with incredibly reasonably priced premium levels (although I've not needed to upgrade from free yet so can't comment on their pros & cons). You can add your own pain descriptors and chart things like mental fog and fatigue. It doesn't take too long to fill out and you can easily change the entry date. The only thing I "don't like" is that it defaults to filling out the daily reflection rather than pain when opening the app. Definitely recommend for chronic pain sufferers!

Really useful for tracking pain, and I like all the options they give you for stuff. Plus you can make your own! I just started tracking my pain and this app has helped give a visual of how much I neglect to address my physical health. Glad I stumbled upon this :)

I started using this app because I know I will need a lengthy history to be diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I like how easy this app is to use and record my daily symptoms and over all how Im feeling. This app is super helpful.
Love this. Most apps that track your activities etc are very limited without subscribing but this one has a lot of free features and is a great way of keeping track of patterns

title: Spondylitis Support
description:
MySpondylitisTeam is a social network and support group for those living with axSpA and other types of spondylitis. Get the emotional support you need from others like you, get practical tips to manage your life with spondylitis, and insights about treatment or therapies. MySpondylitisTeam is the only social network where you can truly connect, make real friendships, and share daily ups and downs in a judgment-free place.

-Keep up and follow members photos & updates
-Quick photo buttons so you don't miss a beat 
-Post updates about the daily ups & downs 
-Get/Give instant hugs, likes & comments of support 
-Search the Q+A section/ask and answer questions 
-Add others to your team 
-Find others near you and like you
-Add your diagnosis and view others

MySpondylitisTeam is for those living with axSpA and other types of spondylitis.


We welcome your feedback! 
Please email us at support@myspondylitisteam.com with your comments & suggestions.

recentChanges:
Newly released: Badge count for your notifications in the app, and several feature enhancements.

We are also excited for what's coming up next: global search! In the meantime, we'd love to hear more feedback from you at support@myspondylitisteam.com.
comments: Loving talking to other who experience our chronic heath and pain management. They totally understand. Finally it is nice to meet them because I dont know anyone personally have AS. It's hard to try to explain it to someone who never probably even never had to deal with this and how it effects you, emotionally, physically, etc. Everyone I have meet so far a wonderful. Sharing our experiences. I love this!
Doesn't work. Only get a blank screen that goes no where.
na
All I get is a white screen.  :P

title: My Arthritis
description:
My Arthritis Care is a clinician-approved, patient-designed app for patients with the following conditions:

	‚Ä¢	Rheumatoid Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Psoriatic Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Enteropathic Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Ankylosing Spondylitis
	‚Ä¢	Osteoarthritis
	‚Ä¢	Osteoporosis
	‚Ä¢	Undifferentiated Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
	‚Ä¢	Sjogren‚Äôs syndrome
	‚Ä¢	Vasculitis
	‚Ä¢	Scleroderma
	‚Ä¢	Behcet‚Äôs syndrome
	‚Ä¢	Sarcoidosis. 

The app - and its clinician-focused counterpart, HealthSuite - helps patients take control of their condition and improve their health outcomes.

Anyone can use the app to 
	‚Ä¢	track flares and maintain a symptom log to identify what may be causing them
	‚Ä¢	manage your care plan, medication and hospital/GP appointments
	‚Ä¢	access and share your medical records from anywhere
	‚Ä¢	obtain advice and discover local events organised by leading patient groups
	‚Ä¢	access useful information from National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society

Patients whose clinical teams have signed up can also
	‚Ä¢	communicate with their care teams via messaging and phone
	‚Ä¢	report symptoms remotely, allowing care teams to intervene early as required

The app was co-developed with leading academics and clinicians at Kings College Hospital, with inputs from patients and patient groups.

We‚Äôre committed to continuously improving our service to make it more useful to patients and clinicians, so please look out for regular updates.

recentChanges: Bug fixes and minor improvements
comments: I have been using it for one week, entering notes and have medication reminder set up. It was simple to use BUT now the app crashes on launch... So I lost all my notes..

I was frequently diagnosed with RA, a lot of medications, appointments, blood tests and exercises were thrown at me. I have had such a hard time keeping track of my medications and appointments and this app helps me keep everything organized in one place. It reminds me to take my medications on time, when my next appointment Is and keep track of my condition. The app includes articles that give useful tips, based on your condition. If you have any form of arthritis this app helps a lot.
I downloaded this a couple of weeks ago. It's easy to use and helps me keep track of my symptoms and medication, especially as I have just started on new injections.
You fill in your details and get pin . On entering email and pin goes back to sign up or sign in screen. Every time I try to log in.

title: Spondylosis Spondylitis
description:
The application is to help remove pain arising out of spondylitis, arthritis, back pain and other back problems.

There is degeracy and no permanent cure is offered for Spondylitis and back pain. The patient continues to be on medication lifelong wasting his hard earned money and suffering from pain. Due to pain, sleep is affected and this adds to the problem and also becomes a cause for further diseases.

We just suggest few exercises and yoga, some simple rules to follow so as  to overcome the problem without any medicine and relieve the pain. Also, these exercises go a long way in curing other problems related to aging.

Great job, thanks a lot
I'm sure that this app Will help my mom to get rid of pain... thanks for such a good app üòä
Very helpful tips
Useful for some people

title: Chronic Insights: 3D symptom diary
description:
For chronic pain warriors, spoonies and anyone with invisible chronic conditions - this app is for YOU!

- Make chronic pain visible by recording your symptoms on interactive 3D mannequins. Let people see what it feels like - a picture really is worth a thousand words!

- Wear OS smart watch integration: quick-record symptom levels without your phone; automatically record your step count to your symptom diary and see how it affects your symptoms

- Export notes, charts, step count and heatmaps to PDF and Excel

- Get ideas, news and product reviews made by people with chronic pain

- Have all your symptom history at your finger tips. Spot long term trends and patterns

- Made by people with chronic pain - we know what it's like

title: Healthy Spine & Straight Posture - Back exercises
description:
‚≠ê As it is said, "Human is as young and healthy as flexible his spine." Nowadays, the problem of the lack of neck and back pain relieving exercises, lack flexibility and bad posture correction are very common.

üèÜ To have a healthy spine is very important. Our back workout at home and flexibility training - is that thing what every busy person must do. 
Let's do a simple experiment: stand up straight, keep legs straight, and try to touch the floor with your palms. Is it hard? If you can't touch the floor, if you have any tension or any kind of neck pain - you definitely should do yoga for spine health, which on is characterized by its flexibility, so pre-take care of your health, make stretches for back pain exercises and do posture correction exercise for women, spinal stim. 

Application features:
‚úîÔ∏è 90 different types of back exercises for men at home with a detailed video, audio and text instructions for each scoliosis exercise;
‚úîÔ∏è 3 time - tested programs based on yoga for spine health principles ‚Äì make a great back muscles workout at home;
‚úîÔ∏è The system of motivation and rewards ‚Äì keep motivated and do spine exercises every day and create better posture;
‚úîÔ∏è Set reminders and notifications ‚Äì now you will never forget to do yoga for neck pain;
‚úîÔ∏è Develop personal training programs and use scoliosis meter;
‚úîÔ∏è The system of statistics of your results - track spine flexibility every day.

Most people have a sedentary lifestyle. Modern life is forcing people to spend more time sitting - when you sit for a long time in the office, in a car or a bus, it causes great harm to the body. Most often there is no possibility to completely change the way of life, but there is always the opportunity to do healthy spine workout. Just do back pain relieving exercises to receive more energy in your life. Stooped, sharp shocks and prolonged compression loads can cause vertebrae to shift and pinch the nerves of the spinal disc. Everyone needs to improve bad posture!

That is why every person should do back flexibility stretches and just follow the straight posture app instructions for the spinal stim health.
In addition, a permanent job in the office and at the computer has a very negative impact on our posture, and hence there is a slouch (as a result - the lack of energy and general malaise, headache). The only way is to do stretches for back pain exercises. Therefore, posture correction exercise for men and neck pain are connected with each other.

The only thing you need to do is just follow our virtual instructor recommendations and do the back exercises for women & men. And the results will definitely come in a short time. Let us do an experiment. Try to do the first week in the yoga for better posture correction app & spine workout...

What is spinal scoliosis?
The Scoliosis is a fairly common disease, which is the companion of many people due to the characteristics of the modern lifestyle. Scoliosis exercise app will take care of this. Back flexibility training & workout will become a great assistant with it. The danger of the spinal cord injury is not only in the aesthetic imperfection of the figure. It leads to chest deformity, which causes cardiac muscle overvoltage and breathing problems. One of the effective measures of therapy is gymnastics in scoliosis app, and to do special back exercises for women at home. And you will fix your bad posture and spinal disc!

This app is for:
The main goal of this application is to create a stable habit of back flexibility stretches, strengthen them and make flexible. Finally, try to do spine exercises for at least a week, and you will definitely see results and will become more energetic. This app is developed for all age groups. Posture exercises are divided by difficulty and are suitable for both men, women, children, and elderly people and for everyone who needs spinal cord injury exercise.

recentChanges:
Dear mEL Studio community,
this is a major update, which includes:
-new design features;

title: Text Neck - Forward Head Posture Correction
description:
üëâDo you want to have a perfect posture? What if we tell you that you can have it? With simple exercises and stretches and no need for equipment! Text Neck App will guide you! üëç  Download it now and start improving your posture! ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâForward Head Posture is the anterior positioning of the head to the body. The main causes of it are prolonged computer use - tech neck, studying while keeping your head forward, looking down on smartphone for a long time - text neck, or any other postures that make your head lean forward or bend down. 

üëâBeing aware of the problem is the first step in fixing bad posture. We will help you determine what is the problem and how to fix it. Neck stretches and exercises will help you regain control of your neck position and good posture overall.

üëâYou can choose between Female and Male trainer to guide you in our application. Bad neck posture is one of the leading causes of shoulder tension, back pain and neck pain. ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâCorrect posture is important for your overall health and well-being. Your body can only function optimally if you have a proper head position and overall good posture. Neck workouts focused on improving your head position and pain relief. ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâPosture Analysis - Check your posture with our questionnaire and test. Follow up on your progress! 

üëâPosture Reminder - With our smart notifications, you can set up custom reminders! Your head position should be your priority, healthy back is determinative for your overall health. 

üëâWe will show you How to fix Forward Head Posture - ‚ÄúText Neck‚Äù with scientifically proven methods. Our custom exercises with guided training are the perfect way to help you improve posture. All exercises are easy and safe to do and you need only 5-8 minutes of your time. Training programs are based on dynamic and static exercises and stretching for your body to develop proper and healthy posture. ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâProper head posture will reduce neck pain. Our app is great as a neck pain treatment with specific exercises and stretches to improve posture. ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâUpper body stretches specially designed as a flexibility workout. Stretching & Flexibility are vital for your well-being and they can help immensely with your neck and back pain. ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâStrengthening the back muscles will help both with lordosis and kyphosis. Your back pain relief should be your priority, start using our app today! ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâCorrective exercises combined with stretches will help in reversing forward head posture, neck pain, and back pain. ‚úîÔ∏è

üëâThe biggest problem with Forward Head Posture is that when your head is pulled forward the additional pressure on your neck, shoulders and back rise dramatically causing serious tissue damage. For every inch, your head is thrust forward from its natural position, it adds another 10-12 Lbs of stress to your neck, shoulder, back, and ultimately spine. ‚úîÔ∏è

Forward Head Posture Symptoms:

‚ùå Back Pain
‚ùå Neck Pain
‚ùå Chronic Neck Pain
‚ùå Restricted Breathing
‚ùå Headaches and migraines
‚ùå Insomnia
‚ùå Chronic Fatigue
‚ùå Mood Swings
‚ùå Numbness and tingling in the arms, hands, and fingers
‚ùå Hunchback
‚ùå A pinched nerve in the neck
‚ùå Bad shoulder posture.

We can help you.‚úÖ

üëâNeck muscle pain relief - The muscles in the neck and in shoulders are responsible for the tension that often leads to a painful, stiff neck. Our stretches at the end of the training program will relieve pain. Neck spasms may happen from poor neck posture, the spasm can even cause headaches. 

üëâThis application is created based on years of scientific research in Medicine and Physiology. 

üëâOur training program is optimal for your health and for your Forward Head Posture Correction, start it as soon as possible and enjoy all the benefits that good posture provides. ‚úîÔ∏è

title: THE SPINE APP
description:
If you are suffering from a spinal condition and would like to understand the causes and the possible treatments you are likely to find THE SPINE APP useful.

What is THE SPINE APP?
THE SPINE APP is a multilingual application designed to help patients from all over the world to get in-depth information about spine diseases including the causes, possible treatments and protocols for decision making regarding surgery. The Spine App can be used to prepare for a doctor's appointment or to help understand a doctor's recommendation. THE SPINE APP is now available in English, German, Russian and Bulgarian. More languages are soon to follow.

Enhance your medical knowledge
With THE SPINE APP you will have a comprehensive guide to the most common spine diseases. 

Created by a vetted spine doctor
THE SPINE APP has been created by an active neurosurgeon with decades of clinical practice. As a result, you get to have up-to-date information regarding spine problems. Links to significant research papers provide readers with the opportunity to doublecheck the information provided in the app. 

Features:
- Learn when you need to contact a doctor
- Find information about the treatment of spine disease
- Understand how decisions about surgery are being made
- Receive information about the most common spinal problems like:

DEGENERATIVE SPINE DISEASE 
Cervical Disc Herniation
Thoracic Disc Herniation
Lumbar Disc Herniation
Cervical spinal canal stenosis
Lumbar spinal canal stenosis
Lumbar epidural spinal canal lipomatosis
Ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament (OPLL)
Synovial Facet Cyst
Degenerative spondylolisthesis in the lumbar spine
Facet joint pain
Cervical facet joint pain
Thoracic facet joint pain
Lumbar facet joint pain
Sacroiliac joint pain
Baastrup syndrome
Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis

SPINAL TRAUMA 
Fractures of the condyles (C0)
Fractures of the atlas (C1)
Traumatic occipitocervical dislocation
Acquired occipitocervical instability
Fractures of the axis (C2)
Fractures of the odontoid proces of the axis (C2)
Hangman fractures
Fractures of the vertebral arches of C2
Fractures of the cervical vertebral bodies C3-C7
Clay-shoveler fracture
Cervical Facet Dislocations & Fractures
Chance Fracture (flexion-distraction injury)
Osteoporotic Vertebral Compression Fracture
Traumatic spondylolisthesis
Postsurgical spondylolisthesis
Pathologic fracture
Bleeding in the spinal canal

INFLAMMA TORY SPINE DISEASE 
Spinal abscess
Spondylodiscitis
Basilar invagination
Ankylosing spondylitis (Bechterew's disease)
Morbus Scheuermann
Inflammatory myelitis

SPINAL TUMORS 
Osteoid osteoma/osteoblastoma
Chondroma
Osteochondroma
Chondroblastoma
Chondromyxoid fibroma
Hemangioma
Benign fibrous histiocytoma
Aneurysmal cyst
Eosinophilic granuloma
Giant cell tumor (osteoclastoma)
Ependymoma
Spinal neurinoma
Meningoma
Myeloma/Plasmacytoma/Plasmacytoma
Astrocytoma
Ganglioneuroblastoma
Ganglioneuroma
Chest tumor
Epidermoid cyst
Metastasis
Paraganglioma
Sarcoma
Hemangiopericytoma
Lymphoma
Neuroblastoma

DEFORMITIES & MALFORMATIONS
Congenital scoliosis
Neuromuscular scoliosis
Infantile idiopathic scoliosis
Juvenile idiopathic scoliosis
Adolescent idiopathic scoliosis
Tethered cord syndrome
Myelomeningocele
Spina bifida
Syringomyelia
Dysplastic spondylolisthesis in the lumbar spine
Isthmitic spondylolisthesis in the lumbar spine
Arteriovenous malformation (AVM)

comments: This app is super informative, very easy to navigate and provides wonderful ideas on what to ask in certain medical situations. This is a wonderful resource for anyone dealing with spinal medical conditions or injuries. I believe it's easy to use format will make it invaluable to even those who aren't "techy".

This app is an easy to use guide to spine disease. It is a great tool for patients preparing for consultation with a spine surgeon and gives invaluable tips on how to know it's time for surgery. This app provides all the essential information needed for decision-making while treating spinal disorders. Embedded links to medical publications help the user to review the information provided by the app. Despite being written by a non-native speaker (the author is a professor in Heidelberg, Germany),

An app of good quality. The pictures are of high quality and precision. The app is available in my native German - which is flawless and clear. Weaknesses: Not all diseases are well explained. Some tumors of the spine are described in a few words. There are also missing pictures. I found some missing commas in the German text.

While using this app for the past couple days I have come uppon extensive research about spinal injuries and how to treat them accordingly, this app is very well put together. The translations for multiple languages makes the widens the audiance and all together is a great app.
Very useful app! The PDF generator works great, the quality of created pages is fantastic. Recommend it for patients and medics!

title: RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS DIET - TO EASE PAIN
description:
When it comes to long-term treatment options for rheumatoid arthritis, you may not realize that your diet can have a significant impact on your symptoms. This app is all about rheumatoid arthritis diet benefits, foods to eat, avoid, exercises to consider. Anti inflammatory drinks, Mediterranean diet, rheumatoid arthritis diet recipes and so much more is included. With each update more will be added.

We have included so far:

What is Rheumatoid Arthritis
Anti Inflammatory Drinks
Anti-Inflammatory Diet For Rheumatoid Arthritis
Mediterranean Diet Benefits For Rheumatoid Arthritis

Healthy Foods That Reduce Inflammation 
Foods To Avoid With Rheumatoid Arthritis
Rheumatoid Arthritis Exercises
Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet Recipes
Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet Tips

comments: Advises the consumption of nightshade plants which is disastrous for inflammation in many autoimmune arthritis patients. Contradictory advice - avoid gluten, but eat lots of organic pasta?! - doesn't make sense. I can find far more reliable info on Google. Uninstalled.
I thought there would be more diet advice

summary: Easy-to-use,home physiotherapy exercise app for u to keep fit and healthy
recentChanges: Bug Fixes.
comments: Had to uninstall. I could never get it to tell me less than 5 days per week. I'm supposed to do 3 days per week, both shoulders, 2 sessions, 15 reps per session with resistance bands and eventually increase the reps and resistance. I couldn't get it to show less than 5 days per week no matter what I clicked on. I gave up. I just wanted to find an app where I could find my exercises and keep track as I did them, hopefully with video or images to ensure I was doing them right.

Before using this app I couldnt drive or sit at all. I even struggled to use the toilet and tie my shoe laces. I spent most of my days laying flat or standing just to avoid the pain. Any bending or sitting position sent me into immediate and terrifyingly painful muscle spasms. Within 7 days of using this app I was recovering nicely without any more prescription meds. Within 6 weeks, my core was solid and I could start exercising, bending and every other normal activity.

My literal only issue is that it doesnt have a "both" option on many pain areas, like knees. So I do 30 minutes on one side and reset it. When you start a plan, it gives you new exercises every day. You can go back and do old ones. Best PT, pain, gentle yoga app Ive used. Chronic Pain sufferer who cannot keep track of reps in sets is very pleased. Very sore, but not as bad as trying to do standard workouts. This is specific - functional exercises, not broadspectrum. Great for fibro/ddd/etc
I was so excited about this app. I finally could do exercises for my specific issues. However the plan never works. My screen goes black right after the welcome video. I'm so disappointed.
The screen is black and the session doesn't move forward properly. It's very frustrating.

title: Rheumatology Connect
description:
Rheumatology Connect is a great source of information for people in the Torbay area with rheumatic conditions. These include:
Rheumatoid arthritis
Psoriatic arthritis
Spondyloarthritis or Ankylosing Spondylitis
Osteoarthritis
Gout and Pseudogout 
Connective tissue diseases including SLE, Sjogren‚Äôs, scleroderma, myositis and vasculitis
With the help of high-quality and informative videos, this app describes each condition and explains which treatments are available.

You‚Äôll also find contact information for people at the Torbay Rheumatology Department who you can contact by email or telephone for advice, as well as a range of support documents and guides that can help you manage your condition.

Developed by Dr Kirsten Mackay, the Rheumatology Department, existing patients and Health & Care Videos, this app will support you throughout your time with the Torbay Hospital. It brings all the information you need into one place and ensures help is never too far away.

title: ArthritisPower
description: The ArthritisPower registry was developed to empower people with arthritis, bone, autoimmune, and inflammatory skin diseases to fight back by participating in real-world, patient-centric research. With this app, you will be able to track YOUR symptoms, health and wellness using surveys, completing validated patient reporting outcomes questionnaires and using data captured by your phone (biosensor data) to monitor well-being. ArthritisPower enables participants to also track medications, medical history and to share health information with care providers, family members, etc. at their discretion. ArthritisPower has the ability to run on a smartphone App and on the web for PCs, giving participants the ability to stay connected whenever they want. Come join the fight and help others as you help yourself, track your health and use your data to help combat joint, bone and skin diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, psoriasis, psoriatic arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, lupus, gout and other conditions.

title: Back Pain - causes, symptoms, treatments
description:
Back pain is a common reason for absence from work and doctor visits. Although back pain may be painful and uncomfortable, it is not usually serious. Even though back pain can affect people of any age, it is significantly more common among adults aged between 35 and 55 years. Experts say that back pain is associated with the way our bones, muscles and ligaments in our backs work and connect together.

Pain in the lower back may be linked to the bony lumbar spine, discs between the vertebrae, ligaments around the spine and discs, spinal cord and nerves, lower back muscles, abdomen and pelvic internal organs, and the skin around the lumbar area.

Pain in the upper back may be due to disorders of the aorta, tumors in the chest, and spine inflammation.

Back pain is a common problem that affects most people at some point or time in their life. Your back is a complex structure made up of bones, muscles, nerves and joints. This can often make it difficult to pinpoint the exact cause of the pain.Most cases of back pain aren't caused by serious damage or disease but by minor sprains, strains or injuries, or a pinched or irritated nerve.

These types of back pain can be triggered by everyday activities at home or at work, or they can develop gradually, over time.

We encourage you to read and follow the guidelines in this back pain app and it will help you in the long run.

title: 6 Minute Back Pain Relief
description:
6 Minute Back Pain Relief is a research-backed workout program built for people who suffer from back pain or who want to stretch and exercise their back to prevent problems in the future. The exercises and yoga poses featured in this app come highly recommended by the leading physiotherapists and are very easy to do, but will make your back feel wonderful. 

These exercises do not require any equipment, and therefore, can be done anywhere, whenever you want to give your back a nice stretch.

Our goal is to help people who suffer from mild back pain, stiff neck and shoulders or other discomfort created due to sitting for long periods of time. If you don‚Äôt have the time to spend hours at the gym, but need a bunch of great exercises that will make your back feel great, check out 6 Minute Back Pain Relief! 

App features include: 

- Stunning design with easy to follow exercises and timers
- Clear instructions + links to videos for each exercise to guide you 
- All content is INCLUDED (no additional charges, and no need for internet connectivity) 
- Reminder notifications that can be adjusted to fit your busy lifestyle 
- Track your activity with our activity calendar and monthly graph

* Please consult with your physician or other medical professional before performing any exercises featured in this app, especially if you suffer from serious back pain, hernia or protrusion of the spine.

recentChanges: Minor Fixes
comments: Having back pain on a daily basis, I have tried these excercises out of desperation . They do work great to alleviate back pain . Even better than pain relievers and i cant tell you how happy I am about this app. Theres only a few excercises, so you can learn them quickly. Now that I do them regularly, it helps stop my back pain BEFORE it starts. I strongly recommend this app to anyone suffering from mild to severe, occasional or chronic back pain. Try it...I guarantee you'll be glad you did.

Great concept! I would suggest verbal instructions, as it is nearly impossible to view the excercises being displayed while doing them. Also, a time gap between the exercises and rest periods of about 10seconds would be more convenient, as this gives one opportunity to switch positions, without having to pause. I would also suggest displaying the exercises (and their demos) before the session starts, as to allow the user opportunity to familiarise themselves with the excercises and do them well!

Good app ,& easy could be better. I like the 6mins just enough to get the chair kinks out. Cannot set to repeat every couple of hours. This needs cues like chimes or dings to tell how long to hold each pose in order to follow avatar without having to constantly keep eyes on the phone, annoying! Transition from resting to next exercise is too fast, is frustrating, and must rush to catch up. That's the reason for stars. Would pay for a pro version if this app was a bit more intuitive.
Very good. Also why did you cut short your per session exercises to 3?. I love the old way of doing all the exercises at once. Please see if you can include all of them.
So cool, there're lots of exercises useful, also has access youtube link to do correct the exercises from trainers. Thanks for all for this app creators üëçüëçüëç

title: ASpire ASDAS
description:
The ASpire ASDAS application is an exciting new application designed designed by experts to help patients with Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) manage and learn more about their condition. Aspire App is multilingual and is available in English, Mandarin, Malay, Tamil and Bahasa language versions.  ASpire provides you instant access to a comprehensive list of medical information, exercise videos and assessments to help you manage your AS better. ASpire includes both BASDAI and ASDAS questionnaires to assess the severity of the AS condition. Users can use these to monitor their condition over time and, if paired with a prescription, track any subsequent improvement. ASpire also includes a reminders feature to remind users when to record BASDAI/ASDAS scores, take their treatment, or attend an appointment at their hospital. Regular blood tests (CRP), if required can also be stored in this app.

ASpire uses innovative tracking technology to monitor progress over time and allows visualisation of the data via easy to use graphs. You also have the ability to share this information with your healthcare professional.

 
About the App:
Funding for this app has been provided by Novartis Pharmaceuticals Limited, Singapore  (NP4 Number # :SG1907712617). With ASDAS all information is securely encrypted on your devices and our secure servers. We agree never to access your data without getting your permission first. This app has been endorsed by the National Arthritis Foundation of Singapore.

title: Arthritis Tracker
description:
Created with young people for young people, Arthritis Tracker lets you rate your symptoms in seconds and see a summary of your recent pain, sore joints (e.g. knee, fingers, hands), medication side effects, energy levels, activity, sleep and emotions. 

You can use these summaries to help you talk to your healthcare professionals at medical appointments or simply to see how you‚Äôve been doing recently.

With Arthritis Tracker, you can also:
-learn how to handle your symptoms, your flare-ups, manage your stress, and reduce the impact that arthritis has on your daily life 
-get tips on talking to other people about your arthritis
-find out how you can manage your condition alongside your school or university coursework and exams
-read stories from other young people with arthritis and get inspired by their experiences and advice 
-get trusted information about juvenile idiopathic arthritis
-find information about Versus Arthritis events coming up in the UK
-learn how to connect with Versus Arthritis and get support online.

Arthritis Tracker is designed for young people aged 13 to 25, and Versus Arthritis is always working to incorporate young people‚Äôs ideas about how to make the app better. Learn more about the improvements we‚Äôve made here: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker

Healthcare professionals who treat people with juvenile idiopathic arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus or other inflammatory conditions (e.g. rheumatologists, rheumatology teams) can order leaflets for their clinics and get ideas about how to use Arthritis Tracker during health appointments. Visit Versus Arthritis for more information: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker-health-professionals

You can use these summaries to help you talk to your healthcare professionals at medical appointments or simply to see how you‚Äôve been doing recently.

-learn how to handle your symptoms, your flare-ups, manage your stress, and reduce the impact that arthritis has on your daily life
-get tips on talking to other people about your arthritis
-find out how you can manage your condition alongside your school or university coursework and exams
-read stories from other young people with arthritis and get inspired by their experiences and advice
-get trusted information about juvenile idiopathic arthritis
-find information about Versus Arthritis events coming up in the UK
-learn how to connect with Versus Arthritis and get support online.

Arthritis Tracker is designed for young people aged 13 to 25, and Versus Arthritis is always working to incorporate young people‚Äôs ideas about how to make the app better. Learn more about the improvements we‚Äôve made here: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker

Healthcare professionals who treat people with juvenile idiopathic arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus or other inflammatory conditions (e.g. rheumatologists, rheumatology teams) can order leaflets for their clinics and get ideas about how to use Arthritis Tracker during health appointments. Visit Versus Arthritis for more information: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker-health-professionals

title: Workout for Arthritis
description:
This app outlines six very important steps take to relieve the pain of osteoarthritis, while keeping your joints in good working condition. 
With arthritis, pain relief is probably the first thing on your mind. In most cases, it‚Äôs the pain that prompts a patient to seek help. Your physician will advise you on the best way to relieve this pain. After you‚Äôve received this advice, this app can help remind you of the things he‚Äôs advised you to do. For example, it tells how to apply heat to aching joints, and explains the Importance of taking your medicine to relieve pain or to prevent the pain from getting worse.
This app also illustrates a series of exercises specifically intended for arthritic joints: to help keep them flexible and to help control the pain. This app is reference for doctors and patients.

title: Posture Corrector - Exercises To Improve Posture
description:
Sit and stand with proper posture and you will physically look 10 years younger and 10 pounds lighter. Psychologically, good posture conveys confidence, poise and leadership.
Use our App to learn about good posture, poor posture, what causes posture problems and how to fix and improve your posture.

How important is correct posture for overall health?
Correct posture aligns everything in your body. Bones, muscles, ligaments and tendons are all able to function optimally when you sit or stand up straight. Your organs assume their proper placement with good posture.

The best way to improve your posture is to focus on exercises that strengthen your core -- the abdominal and low back muscles that connect to your spine and pelvis.

Posture is the position in which you hold your body upright against gravity while standing, sitting or lying down. Good posture involves training your body to stand, walk, sit and lie in positions where the least strain is placed on supporting muscles and ligaments during movement or weight-bearing activities. Proper posture:

Keeps bones and joints in the correct alignment so that muscles are being used properly.
Helps decrease the abnormal wearing of joint surfaces that could result in arthritis.
Decreases the stress on the ligaments holding the joints of the spine together.
Prevents the spine from becoming fixed in abnormal positions.
Prevents fatigue because muscles are being used more efficiently, allowing the body to use less energy.
Prevents strain or overuse problems.
Prevents backache and muscular pain.
Contributes to a good appearance.

Living with bad posture can be a dangerous thing. The muscle and ligament imbalances that result from poor alignment can lead to all sorts of problems:

Chronic back, neck, and shoulder pain
Foot, knee, hip, and back injuries
Headaches
Stiffness
Fatigue
Muscle atrophy and weakness
Difficulty breathing
Digestion issues
Impingement and nerve compression
Sciatica
Carpal tunnel syndrome
But we're going to fix that right now! By understanding proper posture, you can learn about your own postural deviations and determine which corrective exercises will work best to improve your alignment. With correct alignment and good posture, your lifts will be stronger, your muscles will work more efficiently, you'll help prevent pain and injury, and you'll look and feel a heck of a lot better

Many of the exercises that can teach you how to fix your posture are easy to perform and don‚Äôt require much in the way of equipment. This means you can discover how to improve posture from the privacy of your home and without investing a lot of money. Try some of these posture exercises to reach a new level of health and fitness.

Exercises with animated GIF pictures are included in this free App

title: Neck exercises - Pain relief workout at home
descriptionHTML:
The complete health complex containing the most effective neck exercises at home for every day. Get rid of chronic headache and dizziness, as well as feelings of tension and stiffness in the cervical-collar zone.
The neck training app will help to restore healthy muscle tone, stimulate blood circulation, and improve nervous and muscle mobility of the upper spine. Classes are suitable for everyone and have 3 levels of complexity - for beginners when all neck pain relief exercise performed on a chair, a daily home workout, in which there are both sitting and standing physio exercises for shoulders with osteochondrosis and a more complex training program.

All activities have detailed video and audio instructions. There are performed in smooth and comfortable amplitudes, slowly and consciously. It is recommended to practice neck shoulder workout for stretches daily for the prevention and treatment of osteochondrosis.

Application functionality


‚úì More than 50 different neck pain relief exercise free (and shoulder) with text descriptions, video or photo instructions and audio comments;
‚úì All activities have different levels of difficulty;
‚úì 52 different workouts for 3 months of classes;
‚úì 3 difficulty programs: a training program on a chair, which is carried out completely sitting, as well as 2 more difficult complexes for shoulder and neck stretches, in which the upper parts of the spine are involved;
‚úì A statistics system that will allow you to track your results and successes, how pain changes with training time;
‚úì A system for measuring pain syndromes of a muscle and nervous nature, as well as blood pressure. Such a thing as osteochondrosis requires increased control;
‚úì You can engage in pre-made workouts or create your own classes;
‚úì A system of reminders and notifications that - now you will never forget to do yoga for neck workout at home;
‚úì Flexible training settings - adjust the time for each activity, the time of preparation and rest between them.

Types of neck exercises app activities


‚úì Dynamic - there is a stimulation of blood flow and basic warm-up;
‚úì Static - there is a stretching and warm-up for the muscles and getting rid of the muscle clamps;
‚úì With strengthening - there is a strengthening of the muscle corset, shoulders are already involved here;
‚úì Active dynamic - there is a deep and strong stretching and stimulation of blood circulation;
‚úì Yoga asanas - the focus is on the upper spine and shoulders.

The training complex is designed for 3 months and contains three programs, each of which contains 14 workouts per month. For example, the most difficult complex - stretches for neck pain exercises consist of dynamic and really difficult physio exercises, which should only be started after completing the first and the second programs. Classes are of increasing complexity and do not require any additional equipment. Just 5 to 10 minutes of free time and your phone. The charging principle of the yoga for neck workout at home is based on smoothness, balance and harmonious development. Such training will quickly enter the rhythm of life because a virtual trainer will be an indispensable assistant for conducting classes for pain relief.

Take your first training session, after which you will notice amazing results.

üëç Have a great workout!

Disclaimer: This application is a source of the information and provides no medical advice, should not be used by individuals under age 18 or by pregnant women. It's recommended to consult a doctor and get professional advice to make sure that you can perform this activity.

title: Lower Back Pain and Sciatica Relief Exercises
description:
Lower back pain can be caused by many different things, but if you're looking for general lower back pain relief, these 7 exercises are all what you need.

Back pain arises as a result of physical injury, incorrect posture, and misalignments that are neglected, pulling muscles out of place. If you are one of the 65 million Americans reporting lower back pain and discomfort on a regular basis, it‚Äôs no wonder that we seek relief from this additional stress and strain.

Exercises to Treat Low Back Pain and Sciatica
Lower back pain treatment is solved in a number of ways, but not all of these options are accessible to everyone. For those experiencing mild to moderate pain on occasion, all that might be necessary is a simple pain management medication. Other options might be surgical relief or a chiropractic protocol for moderate to severe pain. If cost is an option and you find yourself in need of pain relief in between medical and chiropractic appointments, however, it might be beneficial to try some simple exercises at home to get the blood flowing and those vertebrae moving.

These lower back strengthening exercises are a great way to strengthen your low back and your core in general. They also help strengthen your glutes, hamstrings, and other pelvic muscles.

Doing these exercises regularly has proven to ease lower back pain and provide some relief from the stress that chronic pain can bring to your daily life. Practice these on a consistent basis, and you‚Äôll be feeling better with each repetition.

Do each of these exercises for 1 minute, emphasis on technique not speed! Take time to hold the positions and really work those muscles. Have a rest in between the sets.

Sciatica is the term used to describe nerve pain in the buttocks, legs and feet. It is caused when the sciatic nerve ‚Äì the longest nerve in the body ‚Äì becomes compressed or irritated. If you‚Äôre suffering with pain that radiates down the back of your leg and into your feet, it could be sciatica.

The sciatic nerve starts at the lower spine before running through the buttock, down the back of the thigh and into the foot. It‚Äôs an important nerve that sends signals from the spinal cord to the entire lower body.

This app contains up to date information on sciatica, its home remedies and pain relief methods.

comments: It's a pretty good app. Basic but it does what I need it to do. It provides me with stretches for the areas I need. And they're randomized too, keeps it fresh. There's also a calender to track your training. I cant imagine what the paid version offers. This one has it all, you can create routines and target specific areas.

Perfect for getting back in shape! Not going to lie, it was hard getting motivated, but this program is easy to use, fun and works magic quickly. My first 4 days (with Flat Belly Diet), I lost 12 pounds and 5" in waist (47" to 42"). I feel great!!

Really really good app covers all the bases and is tailorable to your needs. The only reason it has 4 stars not five is that there is not sufficient explanation of the exercises. Would deffo get a five if that was provided As an idea for improvement it might be nice to add some gentle music in the background while stretching.

Used it first time this morning. Did the back stretches for 10 minutes... I literally feel like a different person. If there was a pay version to remove the ads at the end, I'd totally do it. Great app and look forward to telling people about it!
Excellent easy to use app, exercises are direct and programed for user friendly experience, I like the idea of the instructor showing the movements before each exercise. Thank you for the App. üëç

title: Back Pain Relieving Exercises
description:
As an orthopaedic surgeon i come across many people who suffer from back pain. In majority of the cases , the simple exercises can do wonders.

Prolapsed discs, sciatica, mechanical dysfunction of spine, postural problems and after spine surgery patients shall be benefited with these exercises. 

why i had developed this application:
1) Lot of exercises given on internet but difficult to TRUST as they are being propagated by techies without knowledge of spine biomechanics
2) many a times visit to a physio centre is not possible due to daily busy schedule
3) we tend to forget things when not carried out regularly, so a handout is easy
4) PRECAUTIONS are all we ask from our doctors, but many a times we forget to tell one or the other precaution
5) there were languages issues in my part of the world so i had translated it in HINDI AND PUNJABI. 

THE MOBILE APP IS FREE OF COST, THERE ARE NO PERMISSIONS, NO ADS, LOW ON SPACE(6 MB),ETC.

The mobile shall help people who are suffering from back pain and has recurrent episodes of back pain . It shall prevent RECURRENCE of back pain again.

title: Bewegen met Bechterew
description:
Pati√´nten met de ziekte van Bechterew, die onder behandeling zijn bij de Sint Maartenskliniek, kunnen gebruik maken van de app ‚ÄòBewegen met Bechterew‚Äô. Deze beweeg-app is een aanvullend onderdeel van de behandeling in het gespecialiseerde ziekenhuis. Het stelt pati√´nten in staat om waar en wanneer zij dat zelf willen, de juiste oefeningen te doen om hun klachten te verminderen. De oefeningen die opgenomen zijn in deze beweeg-app, zijn met zorg geselecteerd door fysiotherapeuten en reumatologen verbonden aan de Sint Maartenskliniek. De app is gerealiseerd in samenwerking met Pfizer.

Voordat een pati√´nt de app voor het eerst gebruikt, overlegt hij/zij met de fysiotherapeut. Daarbij wordt gekeken welke oefeningen geschikt zijn en hoe vaak men ze kan herhalen. Nadien kan er zelf geoefend worden met de beweeg-app. In de app worden de oefeningen getoond aan de hand van filmpjes, waarin een model de oefeningen stapsgewijs voordoet. Zo kunnen pati√´nten zien hoe de oefeningen precies moeten worden uitgevoerd, waarbij ze worden geholpen door een voice-over. Door oefeningen vast te leggen in de app (in ‚Äòmijn oefenschema‚Äôs‚Äô) kan er afwisseling aangebracht worden in het oefenschema.

title: Heel Pain: Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
description:
Plantar fasciitis is a disorder of the connective tissue which supports the arch of the foot. It results in pain in the heel and bottom of the foot that is usually most severe with the first steps of the day or following a period of rest. Pain is also frequently brought on by bending the foot and toes up towards the shin. The pain typically comes on gradually, and it affects both feet in about one third of cases. 
The causes of plantar fasciitis are not entirely clear. Risk factors include overuse such as from long periods of standing, an increase in exercise, and obesity. It is also associated with inward rolling of the foot, a tight Achilles tendon, and a lifestyle that involves little exercise. While heel spurs are frequently found it is unclear if they have a role in causing the condition. Plantar fasciitis is a disorder of the insertion site of the ligament on the bone characterized by micro tears, breakdown of collagen, and scarring. Since inflammation plays either a lesser or no role, a review proposed it be renamed plantar fasciosis The diagnosis is typically based on signs and symptoms; ultrasound is sometimes useful. Other conditions with similar symptoms include osteoarthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, heel pad syndrome, and reactive arthritis. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Heel Pain symptoms, Heel Pain Management & Heel Pain causes.
Here are features that make this app better than all other Heel Pain Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free. 

==========================
SAY HELLO
==========================
Any medical information published on this app is not intended as a substitute for informed medical advice and you should not take any action before consulting with a healthcare professional. Our team are nonstop working hard on creation this app. Please feel free to review and email us for any questions/suggestions/complications.

title: Rheumatology UCT
description:
The Division of Rheumatology at the University of Cape Town is very actively involved in teaching, service delivery and research.

Teaching is directed at medical students in their 4th 5th and 6th years of training. There is also training for post graduates specialising in general medicine in the form of registrar rotations through Rheumatology, as well as formal teaching for the Part 1 and Part 2 of the FCP (SA) examinations. Medical registrars rotating through the unit are encouraged to undertake rheumatology topics for the MPhil degree. The Division is highly suited for training super specialists in Rheumatology due to the wide spectrum of rheumatic diseases that are treated in the different clinics.

Service is provided through several outpatient clinics and inpatients admitted to the general medical wards as well as the orthopaedic wards. Patients with severe RA may be admitted for surgery or for rehabilitation purposes. There are 2 new patient clinics per week and 2 follow-up clinics per week. In addition, a weekly Connective Tissue Diseases clinic has been established for treating patients with SLE, Scleroderma, Myositis and different forms of vasculitis, especially Takayasu‚Äôs Disease.

The Division of Rheumatology has several research interests relating to different aspects of the rheumatic diseases. Osteoporosis is an area of interest for many years and there is ongoing collection of longitudinal bone mineral density data in patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). Age-related bone loss at different skeletal sites is being prospectively studied in collaboration with the Department of Nuclear Medicine and the Endocrine Unit. Clinical drug trials are in progress to study the safety and efficacy of the newer non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS), in collaboration with the GIT Unit. These newer COXIBS are being evaluated in patients with RA and osteoarthritis (OA). All of these include collaborative participation with the GIT Unit, where gastropathy is an outcome variable, measured by gastroscopy. Recently, the trials of coxibs have included cardiovascular outcomes as well. We have also been looking at SLE genetics in collaboration with the Hepatology Unit at UCT. Newer areas of research include the study of chronic tophaceous GOUT; community aspects of diagnosing and treating rheumatic diseases at CHC‚Äôs; early rheumatoid arthritis; genetics of bone loss in SLE; and functional problems in ankylosing spondylitis and DMARDs in Psoriatic Arthritis. More recently, we have been involved in studies looking at the short-term and long-term effects of biologic therapiesin the different rheumatic diseases, especially RA.

The rheumatic diseases unit provides in- and outpatient rheumatology services for the entire Western Cape region. Sessions are carried out at the Heideveld and Khayelitsha Community Health Centres 6 times a year. Training is provided on a continuous basis for medical students, allied health professionals, a senior house officer, two rotating medical registrars and two career registrars. Research is largely clinically orientated, but a laboratory-based approach is being used to study the genetics of SLE and the differentiation between flares and infection in SLE patients. Family studies have also been started in patients with SLE and RA. In addition, there is very significant involvement in clinical drug trials in rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, psoriatic arthritis and osteoarthritis. Collaborative research is being carried out with the Liver Unit to study bone density in auto-immune hepatitis.

The Division is highly suited for training super specialists in Rheumatology due to the wide spectrum of rheumatic diseases that are treated in the different clinics.

Service is provided through several outpatient clinics and inpatients admitted to the general medical wards as well as the orthopaedic wards. Patients with severe RA may be admitted for surgery or for rehabilitation purposes. There are 2 new patient clinics per week and 2 follow-up clinics per week. In addition, a weekly Connective Tissue Diseases clinic has been established for treating patients with SLE, Scleroderma, Myositis and different forms of vasculitis, especially Takayasu‚Äôs Disease.

The Division of Rheumatology has several research interests relating to different aspects of the rheumatic diseases. Osteoporosis is an area of interest for many years and there is ongoing collection of longitudinal bone mineral density data in patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). Age-related bone loss at different skeletal sites is being prospectively studied in collaboration with the Department of Nuclear Medicine and the Endocrine Unit. Clinical drug trials are in progress to study the safety and efficacy of the newer non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS), in collaboration with the GIT Unit. These newer COXIBS are being evaluated in patients with RA and osteoarthritis (OA). All of these include collaborative participation with the GIT Unit, where gastropathy is an outcome variable, measured by gastroscopy. Recently, the trials of coxibs have included cardiovascular outcomes as well. We have also been looking at SLE genetics in collaboration with the Hepatology Unit at UCT. Newer areas of research include the study of chronic tophaceous GOUT; community aspects of diagnosing and treating rheumatic diseases at CHC‚Äôs; early rheumatoid arthritis; genetics of bone loss in SLE; and functional problems in ankylosing spondylitis and DMARDs in Psoriatic Arthritis. More recently, we have been involved in studies looking at the short-term and long-term effects of biologic therapiesin the different rheumatic diseases, especially RA.

The rheumatic diseases unit provides in- and outpatient rheumatology services for the entire Western Cape region. Sessions are carried out at the Heideveld and Khayelitsha Community Health Centres 6 times a year. Training is provided on a continuous basis for medical students, allied health professionals, a senior house officer, two rotating medical registrars and two career registrars. Research is largely clinically orientated, but a laboratory-based approach is being used to study the genetics of SLE and the differentiation between flares and infection in SLE patients. Family studies have also been started in patients with SLE and RA. In addition, there is very significant involvement in clinical drug trials in rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, psoriatic arthritis and osteoarthritis. Collaborative research is being carried out with the Liver Unit to study bone density in auto-immune hepatitis.

title: Kyphosis Disease
description: Kyphosis (from Greek Œ∫œÖœÜœåœÇ kyphos, a hump) is an abnormally excessive convex kyphotic curvature of the spine as it occurs in the cervical, thoracic and sacral regions. (Abnormal inward concave lordotic curving of the cervical and lumbar regions of the spine is called lordosis.) Kyphosis can be called roundback or Kelso's hunchback. It can result from degenerative diseases such as arthritis; developmental problems, most commonly Scheuermann's disease; osteoporosis with compression fractures of the vertebra; multiple myeloma or trauma. A normal thoracic spine extends from the 1st to the 12th vertebra and should have a slight kyphotic angle, ranging from 20¬∞ to 45¬∞. When the "roundness" of the upper spine increases past 45¬∞ it is called kyphosis or "hyperkyphosis". Scheuermann's kyphosis is the most classic form of hyperkyphosis and is the result of wedged vertebrae that develop during adolescence. The cause is not currently known and the condition appears to be multifactorial and is seen more frequently in males than females. In the sense of a deformity, it is the pathological curving of the spine, where parts of the spinal column lose some or all of their lordotic profile. This causes a bowing of the back, seen as a slouching posture.

title: back pain üá∫üá∏
description:
How back pain affects your body? or how back pain will come? Don't worry with Our Free App you will Learn everything you need to know about what is back pain. "back pain" or back trouble problems are one of the most common reasons for absence from work and for seeking medical treatment. It can be uncomfortable and debilitating. back trouble or bad back , also known as lumbago Or slipped disk can affect people of any age, for different reasons. how back pain happens? Lower back pain can be caused by problems with the spinal muscles, nerves, bones, tendons or discs. Back trouble commonly stems from strain, tension, or injury. Frequent causes of back pain are : strained muscles or ligaments, a muscle spasm, muscle tension, damaged disks, injuries, fractures, or falls. Activities that can lead to strains or spasms include: lifting something improperly, lifting something that is too heavy, making an abrupt and awkward movement and that's exactly what causes sciatica and how back pain affects your body ?. What is the anatomy of the low back? To understand various causes of low back pain, it is important to appreciate the normal design (anatomy) of the tissues of this area of the body. Important structures of the low back that can be related to symptoms in this region include the bony lumbar spine (vertebrae, singular = vertebra), discs between the vertebrae, ligaments around the spine and discs, spinal cord and nerves, muscles of the low back, internal organs of the pelvis and abdomen, and the skin covering the lumbar area. If you are reading this, Congratulations ! with our free mobile app we will tell you how reduce back pain? and how treat back pain ? A number of alternative treatments may ease symptoms of back pain. Always discuss the benefits and risks with your doctor before starting any new alternative therapy : Chiropractic care 'A chiropractor hand-manipulates your spine to ease your pain' , Acupuncture 'A practitioner of acupuncture inserts sterilized stainless steel needles into the skin at specific points on the body. Some people with low back pain report that acupuncture helps relieve their symptoms', Massage 'If your back pain is caused by tense or overworked muscles, massage might help', Yoga 'There are several types of yoga, a broad discipline that involves practicing specific postures or poses, breathing exercises, and relaxation techniques. Yoga can stretch and strengthen muscles and improve posture, although you might need to modify some poses if they aggravate your symptoms'. description:
How back pain affects your body? or how back pain will come? Don't worry with Our Free App you will Learn everything you need to know about what is back pain. "back pain" or back trouble problems are one of the most common reasons for absence from work and for seeking medical treatment. It can be uncomfortable and debilitating. back trouble or bad back , also known as lumbago Or slipped disk can affect people of any age, for different reasons. how back pain happens? Lower back pain can be caused by problems with the spinal muscles, nerves, bones, tendons or discs. Back trouble commonly stems from strain, tension, or injury. Frequent causes of back pain are : strained muscles or ligaments, a muscle spasm, muscle tension, damaged disks, injuries, fractures, or falls. Activities that can lead to strains or spasms include: lifting something improperly, lifting something that is too heavy, making an abrupt and awkward movement and that's exactly what causes sciatica and how back pain affects your body ?. What is the anatomy of the low back? To understand various causes of low back pain, it is important to appreciate the normal design (anatomy) of the tissues of this area of the body. Important structures of the low back that can be related to symptoms in this region include the bony lumbar spine (vertebrae, singular = vertebra), discs between the vertebrae, ligaments around the spine and discs, spinal cord and nerves, muscles of the low back, internal organs of the pelvis and abdomen, and the skin covering the lumbar area. If you are reading this, Congratulations ! with our free mobile app we will tell you how reduce back pain? and how treat back pain ? A number of alternative treatments may ease symptoms of back pain. Always discuss the benefits and risks with your doctor before starting any new alternative therapy : Chiropractic care 'A chiropractor hand-manipulates your spine to ease your pain' , Acupuncture 'A practitioner of acupuncture inserts sterilized stainless steel needles into the skin at specific points on the body. Some people with low back pain report that acupuncture helps relieve their symptoms', Massage 'If your back pain is caused by tense or overworked muscles, massage might help', Yoga 'There are several types of yoga, a broad discipline that involves practicing specific postures or poses, breathing exercises, and relaxation techniques. Yoga can stretch and strengthen muscles and improve posture, although you might need to modify some poses if they aggravate your symptoms'. Diseases related to Back Pain : Kidney Pain, Pain Management, Back Injuries, Osteoporosis, Pill Identifier, Degenerative Disc Disease, Scoliosis, Ankylosing Spondylitis, Second Opinions, herniated disc, hip pain, neck pain, herniated disc, spinal stenosis, knee pain, sciatic nerve, shoulder pain, sciatica ... and much more. so we are not going to waste any more time and let's take our app , You can get this application to find the answer of What is back pain  absolutely for free RIGHT NOW!
So what are you waiting for?
Download now and enjoy

title: RheumaHelper
description:
** The award-winning mobile tool for rheumatologists **

** Won "Good Practice 2016" the highest award by the leading Slovenian medical publication **
** Named a Top Rheumatoid Arthritis App of 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018 by Healthline **

RheumaHelper is a mobile rheumatology assistant. It provides a complete toolbox of disease activity calculators and classification criteria the informed rheumatologist can reference during day-to-day work. Easy to use and always with you on your mobile phone, RheumaHelper is the perfect tool for rheumatologists.

** Verified content based on published research **

The validity of the content in the application is checked by Prof. Matija Tom≈°iƒç, M.D., Ph.D., head of the Dept. of Rheumatology, and ≈Ωiga Rotar, M.D., rheumatologist at the Dept. of Rheumatology, both at the University Clinical Centre in Ljubljana, Slovenia.

Included classifications:
‚Äî Adult Still's disease [Cush]
‚Äî Adult Still's disease [Yamaguchi]
‚Äî Antiphospholipid syndrome
‚Äî Arthralgia suspicious for progression to RA [2016 EULAR]
‚Äî Axial spondyloarthritis
‚Äî Beh√ßet‚Äôs Disease (ICBD)
‚Äî Fibromyalgia [2016 ACR]
‚Äî Gout [2015 ACR/EULAR]
‚Äî Gout [2014]
‚Äî Idiopathic inflammatory myopathies specification [2017 ACR/EULAR]
‚Äî Inflammatory Back Pain
‚Äî Peripheral spondyloarthritis
‚Äî Polymyalgia rheumatica
‚Äî Primary Sj√∂gren's Syndrome [2016 ACR/EULAR]
‚Äî Psoriatic arthritis
‚Äî Rheumatoid arthritis
‚Äî Systemic lupus erythematosus [ACR]
‚Äî Systemic lupus erythematosus [SLICC]
‚Äî Systemic sclerosis

Included disease activity calculators:
‚Äî ASDAS

‚Äî BVAS [version 3]
‚Äî CDAI / SDAI
‚Äî DAPSA
‚Äî DAS28

‚Äî Five-Factor Score

All of the included classifications and disease activity calculators are based on referenced equations. All references available inside the app.

title: Back pain
description:
A trauma or accident can damage the back muscles and cause muscle spasms and nerve irritation. Such injuries are common in sports or physical work. But often also, trying to reach an object placed high or wanting to lift a load too heavy may be enough to cause a backache.

Herniated disc.

Being injured or carrying a heavy load can also cause the sliding of an intervertebral disc or herniated disc. Thus moved to the spinal canal, the disc presses the nerves that generate pain in the back. Attention, with the age, the discs are altered, increasing the risk of sliding and thus of herniated disc.

Arthritis.

Common arthritis (inflammation), arthritis can also cause back pain. Ankylosing spondylitis, a form of rheumatoid arthritis, also causes back pain.

Osteoarthritis.

This other common condition results from joint wear, which often affects the vertebrae and vertebral joints.

Overweight.

Obesity is one of the factors favoring back pain. Indeed, excess weight exerts excessive pressure on the spine that can cause pain as well as arthritis (inflammation of the joints).

Physical inactivity

Lack of activity weakens the abdominal muscles. As a result, the pressure on the spine increases and can cause back pain.

Bad postures

Nothing like a bad posture to cause a misalignment of the spine, which forces the muscles and presses the nerves. These bad postures are frequent, during the simple walk or in sitting position, but also during activities of all kinds, professional and leisure. And they are favored by stress.

Associated diseases

Back pain can be part of the symptoms of certain diseases. This is the case of fibromyalgia, osteoporosis, ovarian cysts, pregnancy, some infections and some tumors, including the spine.
Prevent back pain

In practice, we can prevent back pain: physical activity, weight loss, good posture, avoid carrying a heavy load, fight against stress, etc.

But in case of persistent or recurrent back pain, it is advisable to consult your doctor in order to explore the causes and to set up a suitable treatment.

Back pain can be part of the symptoms of certain diseases. This is the case of fibromyalgia, osteoporosis, ovarian cysts, pregnancy, some infections and some tumors, including the spine.
Prevent back pain

In practice, we can prevent back pain: physical activity, weight loss, good posture, avoid carrying a heavy load, fight against stress, etc.

But in case of persistent or recurrent back pain, it is advisable to consult your doctor in order to explore the causes and to set up a suitable treatment.
